name: The Slope
description: Similar in approach to the Red Hook, another Brooklyn-themed Manhattan variation, the Slope--named for the borough's Park Slope neighborhood--utilizes an extra-bitter style of vermouth called Punt e Mes, then tempers the bitterness with the stone-fruit sweetness of apricot liqueur. The result is potent, balanced and memorable; an excellent cocktail for a mid-autumn evening.
recipeIngredient: 3/4 ounce Punt e Mes (an Italian vermouth)
1/4 ounce apricot brandy (Marie Brizard’s Apry is recommended)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ingredients in a bar glass and add cracked ice. Stir well for 20 seconds and strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
